context: The word 'lõin' is the 1st person singular past tense form of the Estonian verb 'lööma', meaning to hit or strike. In this context, it's used in the phrase 'kingadele pooltallad alla' which means 'down the soles of shoes'. It indicates the action of hammering or driving something down into place. The word 'alla' (down/below) is part of the construction showing that the action was directed downward.
